intro: Xanthosoma luteynii, commonly known as the yellow arrowhead, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking yellow spatulate flowers, which are typically followed by a spadix. Xanthosoma luteynii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant foliage and unique floral structure. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is relatively easy to care for in suitable climates.
